quest.name: A §trαnge New World
journal: Try as he might, Alphinaud can find no sign of Thancred.
objectives: Gather information at the vitrified fort.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: It's so dark. I can barely see anything...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Didst thou witness what became of Thancred? So quickly was I overcome by Meteion's malevolence that I saw naught of their altercation.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: We were clearly no match for Meteion, yet we survived unscathed. But how...?

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: If Meteion should strike again with such overwhelming force, I honestly don't know how we are to oppose her.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: There is a dizzying, disorienting feeling about this place. As if I could lose my footing at any moment... We must be careful.

dialogue.name: LIVINGWAY
dialogue.text: Don't hesitate to make the most of the provisions node. There's no telling what you might run into out there, or if anything we have to offer might help, but I'd personally rather brave the unknown with a full pack than an empty one.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: We're fortunate this place can support life...albeit barely, I suspect, given the torpid, stale quality of the air...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: But never mind that. We must find Thancred. Let's begin our search from the prow of the ship. It seems as good a direction as any.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Try not to stray too far, lest we lose sight of one another.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: I see no one else in this barren waste, do you? Then why do I feel like we're not alone...like there's another presence with us. Something dark...and mournful...

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: These remains have long since turned to ash...and yet, they retain their form.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: There is a structure here in front of me, yes? A tower of some sort, partially melted? Hmm. In a strange twist of fate, it seems our perception of this place is not so different as it would be elsewhere.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: The world as I used to see it... It feels as though I am dreaming while awake. This is more than the faded memory Meteion led us to believe.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: What was this, I wonder...?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: This...this cannot be real.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Ruins. But of what, I wonder?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Perhaps we can find something to help us understand the nature of this place. A relic, an inscription, anything...

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Be careful, Forename. I cannot shake the feeling we're being watched. Gods, you don't think there are ghosts here...do you?

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The metallic pillar has been partially melted, likely sometime in the distant past.

dialogue.name: SYSTEM
dialogue.text: The damage does not appear to have been inflicted deliberately. Rather, it calls to mind the indiscriminate destruction often wrought in the heat of battle...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Look here─this part is relatively intact.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: The intricate design of the top suggests it is man-made, though its builders were surely not men as we conceive of them.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Having said that, I swear I have seen this pattern before...

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: I know this pattern. But from where...?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: I thought this hill might afford a better view of our surroundings... A poor decision in hindsight.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Besides the light from the ship, all is shrouded in darkness. If Thancred is here, I'd never know it.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: From what I can tell, we are near the edge of an island─if you can call it that─surrounded by floating debris.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Have care should you decide to climb higher. Were you to fall, you might well tumble through the great expanse for all eternity.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Were you able to find anything?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: As I feared. And still no trace of Thancred.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There's nothing but emptiness as far as the eye can see, which, unfortunately, isn't very far.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Though I can't help but suspect that someone...or something is here.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: There are times when I sense it drawing close...and then a chill washes over me, leaving me exhausted.

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: Leaving me with feelings of death and anguish...

dialogue.name: Q1
dialogue.text: What will you say?

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I think I might see something over there...

dialogue.name: A1
dialogue.text: I felt it too when I was near that thing...

dialogue.name: ALISAIE
dialogue.text: What are you talking about? There's nothing there.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: Before we jump to any conclusions, perhaps we should search elsewhere.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Agreed. We've found only more questions when we are in desperate need of answers.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: There's a fair stretch of terrain from the ship's port side we've yet to explore.

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Let us try searching there, then.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Forename. A word, before we join the others.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: You see them too, don't you? The dragons.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: As I thought. Their presence is tenuous at best, but there's no mistaking it.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: No doubt your bond with Midgardsormr, and mine with Nidhogg, is what allows us to perceive them.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Could these apparitions be related to the dragons that now live on Etheirys?

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: ...Bah. Better to leave such conjecture to the others. In any case, we must be careful. We may soon find dragons they can see as well.

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: Hmm... Death and anguish. What happened to them, I wonder?

dialogue.name: ALPHINAUD
dialogue.text: Look there! Are those...are those ghosts, do you think?

dialogue.name: URIANGER
dialogue.text: Surely, mine eyes deceive me. This cannot be possible.

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: My sight may have been restored after a fashion, but I fear what I see cannot be trusted...

dialogue.name: YSHTOLA
dialogue.text: It's as if Meteion herself has etched these images upon my heart. I doubt not that such a feat is within her power, given that she constructed this sanctuary herself.

dialogue.name: GRAHATIA
dialogue.text: Dragons... 'Tis true they are not of our world. But to find them in a prison of despair...

dialogue.name: ESTINIEN
dialogue.text: It seems these dragons have yet to succumb completely to the darkness of this place. Meaning the others should see them as well.
